means: 有倾向性地编写或报道

sentence.Network_en: The political slant at Focus can be described as centre-right.
sentence.Network_cn: 《焦点》杂志的政治立场可以称为中间偏右。

sentence.Network_en: You're slightly above the garden because the house is on a slant.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于房子是倾斜的，所以你的位置稍微高于花园。

sentence.Network_en: Close the window quickly lest the raindrops ( should ) slant in.
sentence.Network_cn: 快关窗户,别让雨点 潲 进来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: variant of dialect slent, of Scandinavian origin, probably influenced by aslant

entry.def: Something that slants is sloping, rather than horizontal or vertical.

example.ex: The morning sun slanted through the glass roof...
example.tran: 清晨的阳光透过玻璃屋顶，斜照了进来。

example.ex: Battered pine floors slanted down to a Georgian window.
example.tran: 破旧的松木地板歪歪斜斜地铺到一个乔治王时代风格的窗户跟前。

entry.def: If something is on a slant, it is in a slanting position.

example.ex: You're slightly above the garden because the house is on a slant.
example.tran: 由于房子是倾斜的，所以你的位置稍微高于花园。

entry.tran: 使有倾向性;使有偏向性
entry.def: If information or a system is slanted, it is made to show favour towards a particular group or opinion.

example.ex: The programme was deliberately slanted to make the home team look good.
example.tran: 这个节目故意偏向主场队，以使他们看上去表现还不错。

entry.tran: (尤指有失偏颇的)观点，看法;偏向;偏袒
entry.def: A particular slant on a subject is a particular way of thinking about it, especially one that is unfair.

example.ex: The political slant at Focus can be described as centre-right...
example.tran: 《焦点》杂志的政治立场可以称为中间偏右。

example.ex: They give a slant to every single news item that's put on the air.
example.tran: 他们播放的每一则新闻都有所偏向。

means.word_mean: 1. a biased way of looking at or presenting something
2. degree of deviation from a horizontal plane;

sentences.sentence: "He biased his presentation so as to please the share holders"

means.word_mean: 3. to incline or bend from a vertical position;

auth_sentence.content: What slant is the media going to take on them?
auth_sentence.res_content: What slant is the media going to take on them?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What slant is the media going to take on them?

auth_sentence.content: He walked down the slant past the guard.
auth_sentence.res_content: He walked down the slant past the guard.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He walked down the slant past the guard.

auth_sentence.content: Piercing the waves...With the slant javelins of rain.
auth_sentence.res_content: Piercing the waves...With the slant javelins of rain.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Piercing the waves...With the slant javelins of rain.

sentences.en: The rays of the late sun slanted in streams through the cypress trees.
sentences.cn: 夕阳的光线一缕缕地从柏树林中斜穿过来。

means.word_mean: 有倾向性地编写或报道

sentences.en: The journalist slanted the report so that the mayor was made to appear incompetent.
sentences.cn: 那位记者做出歪曲报道好让市长显得无能。

sentences.en: The lines are drawn on a slant.

means.word_mean: 倾向, 偏向, 侧重；倾斜，歪斜

sentences.en: The editorial had an antiunion slant.
sentences.cn: 这篇社论有一种反工会的倾向。

jushi.english: The rays of the late sun slanted in streams through the cypress trees.
jushi.chinese: 夕阳的光线一缕缕地从柏树林中斜穿过来。

jushi.english: The carpenter slanted the roof to allow the water to run off.
jushi.chinese: 木匠使屋顶倾斜以便让水流下去。

jushi.english: The journalist slanted the report so that the mayor was made to appear incompetent.
jushi.chinese: 那位记者作出歪曲报道好让市长显得无能。
